titles.title: To provide for the reinstatement of a license for a certain Federal Energy Regulatory project.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Air Quality.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 109-685.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 415.

action.text: Mr. Otter moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4417.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 644.

bill.summary: 9/26/2006--Passed House without amendment. Directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), upon the request of the licensee for the project numbered 7307, to extend the time required for commencement of construction of the project until December 31, 2007. Provides for reinstatement of an expired license.
